ElementWheel_event.summary: The wheel event fires when the user rotates a wheel button on a pointing device (typically a mouse).

remarks.para: This event replaces the non-standard deprecated event.

blockquote.para: Note: Don't confuse the wheel event with the event. The default action of a wheel event is implementation-specific, and doesn't necessarily dispatch a scroll event. Even when it does, the delta* values in the wheel event don't necessarily reflect the content's scrolling direction. Therefore, do not rely on the wheel event's delta* properties to get the scrolling direction. Instead, detect value changes of and of the target in the scroll event.
